details: “D” is the fourth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents a voiced dental or alveolar stop sound, as heard in 'dog' or 'doll'. The letter D originated from the Phoenician letter 'Dalet', which later evolved through the Greek 'Delta'.

wordsData.definition: a domesticated animal often kept as a pet, known for loyalty and barking
wordsData.example: The dog wagged its tail happily when it saw its owner.

wordsData.definition: a percussion instrument that produces sound when struck
wordsData.example: He beat the drum to the rhythm of the music.

wordsData.definition: a waterbird with a broad blunt bill, short legs, and webbed feet
wordsData.example: The duck swam across the pond with its ducklings.

wordsData.definition: a hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building or room
wordsData.example: She opened the door and walked into the house.

content: D is for Dog who likes to play,

rhymes.name: D is for Drum (drumming rhyme)
content: D is for Drum, bang it loud,
Drum so big, it makes us proud!
Beat the rhythm, feel the sound,
Dancing feet will stomp the ground!
